New Records: South Africa had never bowled this many overs of spin in a T20 World Cup match.
Key Match Events: Marco Jansen hit the winning six.
Roston Chase took 3 wickets for 12 runs.
Tabraiz Shamsi took 3 wickets for 27 runs.
Heinrich Klaasen's aggressive batting against Gudakesh Motie was a game-changing moment.
Kagiso Rabada and Marco Jansen successfully chased the target with a crucial partnership.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's victory knocked West Indies out of the tournament and secured their spot in the semi-final.
The win marked South Africa's first T20 World Cup knockout appearance in a decade.
Aiden Markram's captaincy and strategic use of spin were highlighted as key factors in the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was rain-reduced and decided by the DLS method.
South Africa's spinners took 5 wickets for 79 runs in 12 overs.
West Indies faced 57 dot balls in their innings, the most at this T20 World Cup.
South Africa's fielding was eventful with four dropped catches and a collision between Kagiso Rabada and Marco Jansen.
